subject: Politics
title: The US-China Rivalry
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The US-China Rivalry.

hook.text: The US and China trade $700 billion a year â€” and prepare for potential war. They're rivals and partners at once.

buildup.text: China's rise challenges US dominance in trade, technology, military reach, and international institutions.

discovery.text: The 'Thucydides Trap' warns that when a rising power threatens a ruling one, war is the historical norm.

twist.text: Nuclear weapons and economic interdependence make direct war costly. But competition in tech and influence intensifies.

climax.text: Allies are forced to choose sides. Australia, Japan, and Europe balance ties with both powers uneasily.

punchline.text: US-China rivalry defines this century. Everyone must pick a side.

quiz.question: What is the 'Thucydides Trap'?
options: The historical pattern where a rising power's challenge to a ruling power often leads to war
A trade agreement between the US and China
A military alliance in the Pacific region
